attributes.action: ensure that all government ministers hereby forfeit their current wage to that of the “liveable” minimum wage during this period of failure and recession.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We the undersigned recognise that failure cannot and should not be rewarded.  We further recognise the Prime Ministers comments on 27 February 2009 stating “the people who make the mistakes cannot and should not run off with entitlements... this is unjustifiable, unacceptable”. 

We further recognise that this government was complicit in the recent financial turmoil and enacted the legislative framework facilitating this.  

We further recognise that this government has governed over many other failures.
 
We believe that failure cannot and should not be rewarded. Therefore we the undersigned demand that:

1. All government ministers hereby forfeit any pension options over and above that of the state pension awarded during periods of failure.

2. All government ministers hereby forfeit their current wage to that of the “liveable” minimum wage during this period of failure and recession.

3. The government set in process 
action to retrospectively reclaim any and all remunerations paid to the former Prime Minister Mr Tony Blair and any and all former government ministers during this period of time.
